alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 4:58AM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY... .The last wave in a series of cold storms systems is moving southward down the west coast early this morning. Snowfall intensities begin to weaken this morning and dwindle through the day today, and the passage of this system overhead may possibly bring a brief dusting of snow down to sea level this morning. Another weak wave is expected to move southward along the coast tonight, possibly bringing light snow to most areas, including interior valley floors and low elevations near the coast. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Portions of northwest California. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
